stem: Identify the fetal heart rate (FHR) deceleration and its primary cause.
template: A FHR pattern characterized by a gradual decrease and return to baseline that mirrors the uterine contraction is a {{pattern1}}, while a sudden 'V' shaped drop that occurs at any time is a {{pattern2}} caused by cord compression.

rationale.correct: Early (mirror) = Head compression (Benign). Variable (V-shape) = Cord compression (Reposition needed).
rationale.incorrect: Late (after peak) = Uteroplacental insufficiency (Worst - needs oxygen/fluids).
clinicalPearls: Remember VEAL CHOP: Variable-Cord; Early-Head; Accel-Oxygen (OK); Late-Placental.

questionTrap.howToOvercome: If the bottom of the 'dip' is at the same time as the peak of the contraction, it's Early. If the dip starts AFTER the contraction peaks, it's Late.
